page.title: 01Gowanburn and Wainhope
page.content: {General Overview} The greater part of this Domesday Block is covered by the Forestry Commission's plantations. The{Fire {Tower}surmounting{Mount Common} symbolises the importance of the Commission's impact upon the landscape. Near the settlement at Gowanburn open land supports some livestock. The{Bakethin Dam}forms a secondary reservoir at the head of{Kielder {Water.} The land rises to a height of 445 metres above sea level at{Grey's Pike with a great deal of the land being occupied by ,ature forest which is at present beiong "harvested".
